Literature Review: Attribution of extreme events to climate change has become a crucial aspect of understanding the impacts of anthropogenic climate change. The past decade has witnessed a significant increase in attribution studies of extreme weather events, which have provided valuable insights into the connection between real-world experiences of extreme weather events and scientific understanding of climate change. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of attribution studies, highlighting the differences in methods used and the implications for combining attribution statements with probabilistic assessments of climate change impacts. We will also discuss the limitations of existing attribution studies, particularly in countries of the Global South, and the ethical questions surrounding the need and requirement of attribution of extreme events in policy contexts.
